channel.description: Before you can configure any hardware, you need to set up the domain name service (DNS) of your domain. Index Register a domain name Add the domain to DigitalOcean DNS Generate DigitalOcean API token for ACME challenge

item.title: Register a domain name
item.description: To host a web service, one of the first things you will need to do is to register your domain name (e.g., example.com). This will be the root domain name used for all of your service links and it is part of what your users will need to type into their web browsers (or click on) to visit your pages. Domain name registration The public domain name registration system is controlled as an artificially scarce resource that you must pay for the use of.

item.title: Add the domain to DigitalOcean DNS
item.description: The Domain Name System is how you associate your (sub-)domains with an actual IP address on the Internet. Choose any supported DNS provider All examples in this book use DigitalOcean as the DNS provider. You may choose any DNS service that provides a programmatic API supported by go-acme LEGO. Sign up for a DigitalOcean account (using this referral link helps support this site), and follow along to set up your domain’s DNS.

item.title: Generate DigitalOcean API token for ACME challenge
item.description: Choose any supported DNS provider All examples in this book use DigitalOcean as the DNS provider. You may choose any DNS service that provides a programmatic API supported by go-acme LEGO. Sign up for a DigitalOcean account (using this referral link helps support this site), and follow along to create the required API token. DNS is also a part of the TLS certificate request process with Let’s Encrypt (via ACME DNS-01 challenge).
